properties.name: Historic Areas of Istanbul
properties.description: Posted by Dogwhisperer    With its strategic location on the Bosphorus peninsula between the Balkans and Anatolia, the Black Sea and the Mediterranean, Istanbul has been associated with major political, religious and artistic events for more than 2,000 years. Its masterpieces include the ancient Hippodrome of Constantine, the 6th-century Hagia Sophia and the 16th-century Süleymaniye Mosque, all now under threat from population pressure, industrial pollution and uncontrolled urbanization.

properties.name: Homestead
properties.description: Posted by Dogwhisperer   Johnstown, PAHundred years of family history here. Five generations, four of which I remember. My great grandparents bought the place in 1913, so my grandmother grew up here, and then so did my father. At some point, my great grandmother\'s parents moved in.... hence the five generations John Warren survived the Johnstown Flood of 1889 because he was at work. His whole family was wiped out. He died before I was born, but he lived here, and was waked right here in the same room I\'m typing this. I have a photo of him on "my" front porch, and a strong sense of all my forebears here....

properties.name: Roskilde Cathedral
properties.description: Posted by Dogwhisperer    Built in the 12th and 13th centuries, this was Scandinavia\'s first Gothic cathedral to be built of brick and it encouraged the spread of this style throughout northern Europe. It has been the mausoleum of the Danish royal family since the 15th century. Porches and side chapels were added up to the end of the 19th century. Thus it provides a clear overview of the development of European religious architecture.
